$CSCO $ANET $LITE $IIVI  
 
 
Ciena ($CIEN) Chief Executive Gary Smith said, in a statement that the company saw "continued broad-based demand" that drove strong orders during the quarter" that helped it gain more visibility into the rest of its fiscal year. 
 
"We expect our strategic investments to drive a significant increase in supply chain capacity in the second half [of the year]," Smith said, adding that he was "confident' in Ciena's (CIEN) ability to show strong revenue growth through the year. 
 
Ciena (CIEN) said Converged Packet Optical sales totaled $540.9 million, up 5.6% from a year ago, while Routing and Switching rose 33.3%, to $85.7 million, Platform Software and Services sales reached $72.9 million, up 46.1%, and Blue Planet Automation Software and services rose almost 25%, to $21.1 million. 
 
https://seekingalpha.com/news/3810311-ciena-drops-5-amid-modest-growth-in-core-segment

Ciena ($CIEN) shares dropped almost 9%, Monday after the networking communications company reported fiscal first-quarter revenue came in merely in line with expectations. 
 
Prior to Monday's start of trading, Ciena (CIEN) reported a profit, excluding one-time items of 47 cents share, on $844.4 million in revenue. Analysts had forecast the company to earn 45 cents a share, as its sales met Wall Street's estimates. 
 
During the same period a year ago, Ciena (CIEN) earned 52 cents a share, while sales grew 11.5% from $757.1 million. 
 
Gross margins ticked down slightly, to 45.5% from 47.3% a year ago, and operating expenses rose nearly 15%, to $324.2 million. Operating margin dropped 2.9 points, to 7.1%. 
 
On a non-GAAP basis, gross margin dipped to 46.2%, adjusted operating expenses rose to $290 million, and operating margin fell 2.8 points to 11.8%. EBITDA dropped 7.5% to $123.7 million.
